intro: Diplocaulobium begaudii, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as forest floors or along stream banks. It has a fibrous root system and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
